subj-group.subject: Geographies at Work in Asian History

title-group.article-title: The Limits of Tartary: Manchuria in Imperial and National Geographies

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1998 Association for Asian Studies, Inc.

abstract.p: Mark C. Elliott examines the Qing geographical imagination as it related to the frontier region of Manchuria. He identifies the different approaches adopted by the Qing court toward this area and shows how each of these perspectives generated a separate geographical and political identity for the region.

p.mixed-citation: Edict to Anjuhū of KX18.9.18 (22 October 1679). The original reads: "mukden-i jergi babe. dorgi bade duibuleci ojorakū. manju-I ba manju cooha tehebi."
